Consistent with this specification of unanticipated aid, we also allow for one Ã¢â¬Ånon-eventÃ¢â¬Â in the narrative record: the failure of Congress to provide state deficit relief following the 1991 recession. See Carlino and Inman (2013a) for details. TABLE 2: Response of Real Per Capita GDP to Fiscal Shocks Ã¢â¬Â

All results are for sample period, 1960:1 to 2010:3. Columns (1) and (2) use a more elastic coefficient specifying the automatic (same quarter) impact of GDP on federal net revenues. Columns (3) and (4) allow for monetary policy variables (federal funds rate and rate of inflation) within the SVAR specification with fiscal policy ordered before monetary policy. Column (5) allows for monetary policy within the NARRATIVE specification with fiscal policy ordered before monetary policy. Columns (6) and (7) report results for the alternative ordering with federal aid variables (AW then AP) preceding federal purchases in the SVAR specification.

Columns (8) and (9) report results for the restricted sample period, 1960:1 to 1998:3 excluding quarters after receipt of the large increase in exogenous state funding from the Tobacco Settlement. Each cell gives the point estimates of the fiscal multiplier impacting GDP evaluated at the sample means for fiscal policies and GDP, and then the lower and upper bounds (within parentheses) for the one standard deviation (68 percent) error band.
